basics.name: Omar Olivares Urrutia
basics.label: AI / Machine Learning Engineer — LLM Agents, Evaluation & RAG Systems
basics.summary: ML Engineer specializing in intelligent agents, LLM evaluation, and production RAG systems. Bridging research rigor with engineering excellence, from benchmarking 19 LLMs on SQL error detection (DataEd'26) to building high-growth open-source coding agents. Experienced in end-to-end ML lifecycles—data collection, fine-tuning, and scalable serving—with a focus on high-impact, user-facing AI products.

work.name: Universidad de Talca
work.summary: Developing an AI-powered educational platform for SQL database learning using multi-agent LLM systems. Addressing limitations in traditional database education through real-time, granular feedback.
highlights: Architecting a multi-agent system to provide real-time syntactic, semantic, and logical feedback on SQL queries
Evaluating and benchmarking LLM agents (Grok, GPT-4o, Claude 3.5, Gemini, DeepSeek) for educational tasks
Built evaluation suite benchmarking 19 LLMs on 300 SQL cases using LLM-as-a-Judge + human-annotated ground truth
Co-authored peer-reviewed paper accepted at DataEd'26 validating the system's pedagogical impact

work.name: Kilo Code
work.summary: Early team member (12-person founding team) of Kilo Code, a high-growth fork of the Cline/Roo-Code open-source coding agent. Joined from project inception to scaling phase.
highlights: Collaborated with the founding team to launch one of the fastest-growing open-source coding agents
Built OpenRouter integrations and technical documentation contributing to #1 model ranking on OpenRouter
Developed integration guides and reference implementations for developer onboarding; project grew to ~10K GitHub stars
Worked directly on technical architecture and strategy with leadership (GitLab founder Sid Sijbrandij's team)

work.name: Emergent Mind
work.summary: Led AI development for an innovative arXiv research discovery platform, building production RAG systems to improve scientific search and analysis.
highlights: Redesigned RAG pipeline (chunking + hybrid retrieval + reranking) improving search relevance for 200K+ indexed papers
Built ingestion and indexing pipelines processing daily arXiv submissions; implemented evaluation harness with Weights & Biases
Deployed FastAPI services with Docker; added tracing and reliability tests for production serving
Conducted experiments to improve model performance and accuracy; oversaw QA processes for AI-driven features

work.name: Neura Pod
work.summary: Led content creation for a popular series exploring neurotechnology and AI, translating complex scientific concepts for a broad audience.
highlights: Translated advanced research into engaging content, contributing to channel growth exceeding 80,000 YouTube subscribers
Produced multiple viral videos surpassing 200,000 views each, fostering public understanding of BCIs and AI
Managed end-to-end production: research, scripting, and distribution across major social media platforms

work.name: Centro Nacional de Inteligencia Artificial
work.summary: Participated in rigorous AI model evaluation tasks for LATAM Spanish language models.

work.name: clicOH
work.summary: Software Engineer at a logistics startup (originally RayoApp, acquired by clicOH).
highlights: Contributed to backend development and system integration post-acquisition
Maintained legacy systems while migrating features to new architecture

work.name: Suncast
work.summary: Summer internship during Computer Science studies. Helped rebuild the platform into a scalable microservices-based architecture.
highlights: Refactored monolithic application into microservices to improve scalability and maintainability
Implemented API endpoints and optimized database queries for renewable energy forecasting platform

work.name: Universidad de Talca
work.summary: Responsible for network resolution, technical support, and IT infrastructure deployment.
highlights: Solved network issues and deployed IT infrastructure alongside the technical team

work.name: Ableton
work.summary: Composed, produced, and engineered tracks for artists.

education.area: Generative AI and Large Language Models

courses: Thesis: Fine-tuned GPT-3.5 for Chile's PAES math exam — improved accuracy from 0.78 to 0.94 (+20%)
Data Structures & Algorithms, Database Systems, Distributed Systems, AI/ML

publications.name: Assessing the Ability of Large Language Models to Identify and Explain Errors in SQL Queries
publications.publisher: DataEd'26: International Workshop on Data Systems Education
publications.summary: Empirical evaluation of 19 LLMs on SQL error detection. Used LLM-as-a-Judge paradigm (300 test cases) and human-annotated ground truth. Findings highlight LLM potential for automated tutoring systems.

publications.name: Optimization of Language Models for Chile's Mathematics Higher Education Admission Test (PAES)
publications.summary: Fine-tuned GPT-3.5 for Chile's PAES mathematics exam. Improved accuracy from 0.78 to 0.94 (+20%) through targeted optimization techniques and OCR/transcription pipelines.

projects.name: Graham Essays
projects.description: Automated EPUB generator for Paul Graham's essays — reached #1 on Hacker News, 800+ GitHub stars
highlights: Reached #1 on Hacker News frontpage
Built automated pipeline processing 200+ essays into EPUB format
800+ GitHub stars; demonstrates open-source community engagement

projects.name: Lucas — AI Finance Agent
projects.description: Agentic AI personal finance assistant with real-time bank API integration
highlights: Built AI-powered finance agent connecting to bank accounts via Fintoc API
Developed within 36-hour hackathon using Anthropic Claude API + FastAPI backend

awards.title: 2nd Place — Computer Vision Hackathon
awards.summary: Built traffic monitoring system detecting congestion and anomalies from CCTV streams, scalable to thousands of cameras.

volunteer.summary: Neuromatch is an online community of computational neuroscientists whose mission is to foster inclusive global interactions for learning, mentorship, networking, and professional development.

certificates.name: IELTS Academic - Overall Band Score 7.5 (C1 Level)
